s1: This course provides foundations and plenty of exercises in practical optimisation problems, while covering all basic elements of optimisation including forms of constraint programming as well as variations on linear programming and convex optimisation.
s2: This course aims to provide students with sufficient knowledge of the basic principles of software project management that they may support a project manager to carry out the project administrative functions of a program office, understand leadership and management within the context of an agile project development team, and understand the context in which project management is conducted.

s1: Be able to apply Linear Programming and Mixed-Integer Programming model to solve real-world problems.
s2: Evaluate the features of traditional and agile approaches to managing software development to decide an appropriate project management approach for a project in a business context.

s1: Be able to recognize and formulate convex optimization problems arising in practice.
s2: Employ research, critical thinking and reflection to formulate and communicate an argument concerning project management concepts.

s1: Demonstrate an understanding of theoretical foundations of convex optimization and be able to use it to characterize optimal solutions to general problems.
s2: Employ research, critical thinking and reflection to formulate and communicate an argument concerning project management concepts.

s1: Be able to define an appropriate local search neighbourhood for a given problem.
s2: Evaluate the features of traditional and agile approaches to managing software development to decide an appropriate project management approach for a project in a business context.

s1: Be able to use a variety of meta-heuristics to escape local minima in a neighbourhood.
s2: Employ research, critical thinking and reflection to formulate and communicate an argument concerning project management concepts.

s1: Demonstrate an understanding of the propagation of a global constraint in a Constraint programming system.
s2: Evaluate the features of traditional and agile approaches to managing software development to decide an appropriate project management approach for a project in a business context.
